column4: ssh usr_name@IP_adress   is it true way to connect a ssh server ?
yes, that's how you do it.
type in sudo apt-get install openssh-server in a terminal
: sudo apt-get install ssh wouldn't install openssh-server
type in sudo apt-get install openssh-server in a terminal
: How can ass with command line its repo ?
: How can add with command line its repo ?
then just uncomment all the lines that start with deb
then when you're done, hit ESC, type in :save /etc/apt/sources.list
ok, now type in sudo apt-get update
ok, now try out sudo apt-get install openssh-server
